item.title: A bus plunges off a bridge in South Africa, killing 45 people
item.description: An 8-year-old child is only survivor. The passengers were headed to an Easter festival before the bus plunged off a bridge on a mountain pass and burst into flames.

item.title: 'Green bubble shaming' at play in DOJ suit against Apple
item.description: Android users have long complained that texting someone with an iPhone on iMessage is an unpleasant experience. The Justice Department argues it is also an example of anti-competitive behavior.

item.title: The Story of an Israeli Man Taken Hostage By Hamas, Now Free
item.description:
We hear the story of an Israeli man taken captive by Hamas on October 7th. He was freed by Israeli special forces 129 days later and talks about his ordeal.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

item.title: 'A generous man': Baltimore bridge worker helped family, community in Honduras
item.description: 38-year-old Maynor Yassir Suazo Sandoval came to the U.S. to make something of himself and to help his family in Honduras. He was one the workers on the Francis Scott Key Bridge when it collapsed.

item.title: Biden administration restores threatened species protections dropped by Trump
item.description: Among the changes, the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service will reinstate a decades-old regulation that mandates blanket protections for species newly classified as threatened.
